ex4D:plugin-description.p: This is a cross platform plugin for sending UDP messages to Growl.
You do not need to install 4D Internet Commands or OpenSSL; it links to 4D's internal OpenSSL for MD5 and UDP functions.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command sends a Growl UDP notification packet.
You can find out more about the UDP protocol from the Growl documentation.

ex4D:argument.label: host
ex4D:argument.p: The host name or IP address of the Growl notification target.

ex4D:argument.label: appName
ex4D:argument.p: The name of the application to register.

ex4D:argument.label: notification
ex4D:argument.p: The name of the Growl notification to register.

ex4D:return-value.label: error
ex4D:return-value.p: The function returns 0 for success, -1 for failure.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command sends a Growl UDP registration packet.
You can find out more about the UDP protocol from the Growl documentation.

ex4D:argument.label: host
ex4D:argument.p: The host name or IP address of the Growl notification target.

ex4D:argument.label: appName
ex4D:argument.p: The name of the application to register.

ex4D:argument.label: notification
ex4D:argument.p: The name of the Growl notification to register.

ex4D:argument.label: title
ex4D:argument.p: The title text of the Growl notification to register.

ex4D:argument.label: description
ex4D:argument.p: The description text of the Growl notification to register.

ex4D:argument.label: sticky
ex4D:argument.p: The sticky flag of the Growl notification.

ex4D:argument.label: priority
ex4D:argument.p: The priority flag of the Growl notification.

ex4D:return-value.label: error
ex4D:return-value.p: The function returns 0 for success, -1 for failure.

ex4D:constant.name: Growl Sticky
ex4D:constant.p: The message will not automatically disappear. (not working on Windows?)

ex4D:constant.name: Growl Priority Very Low
ex4D:constant.p: The message priority is very low.

ex4D:constant.name: Growl Priority Very High
ex4D:constant.p: The message priority is very high.
